description:
Commodity Classification for Foreign Trade Statistics
(8-digit codes)

Explanatory notes for the following statistics:
51000 Foreign trade

Definition:
Since January 1988, the Harmonized Commodity Description and
Coding System (HS) of the Customs Cooperation Council (CCC)
incl. its six-digit codes has formed the basis for the
EU-wide Combined Nomenclature (CN) incl. its eight-digit
code system. The CN corresponds to chapters 01 to 97
(two-digit level) of the Commodity Classification for
Foreign Trade Statistics.
The eight-digit codes of the Commodity Classification for
Foreign Trade Statistics comprise roughly 10,000 eight-digit
commodity codes.


© Statistisches Bundesamt, Wiesbaden 2017
name: Commodity Class. Foreign Trade Stat.(8-digit cod.)
